content:
Se hai installato delle estensioni, disattivale tutte e poi riattivane una per volta fino a trovare il responsabile (vale anche per eventuali temi che hai installato).

Se questo non risolve, disattiva l'accelerazione hardware -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/impostazioni-thunderbird-pannello-avanzate#w_impostazioni-avanzate

Se neppure questo risolve, vai in Tasto menu > Personalizza > Personalizza barra degli strumenti Qui spunta la voce Barra del titolo in modo fa usare la barra del titolo standard di Windows (o del sistema operativo che usi)

content:
We had this in January. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1437175 I suggest you fix your antivirus program so it does not scan the Thunderbird profile folder and corrupts the indexes, then you will not have these recurrent problems.


Note this well. Your 211 questions can be accessed here. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/user/mdm54/ I suggest you refer to your previous correspondence in those 211 question before asking for help for exactly the same issue again.

content: Thunderbird is just an email client. If you deleted the account, you would need to contact mailfence to reestablish it.
creator: davidsk

content:
There is no trapdoor feature for a person with authority to reset the Primary password. To restore access to the accounts, choose Tools -> Developer Tools > Error Console, paste the expression: 

    openDialog("chrome://pippki/content/resetpassword.xul")  and press the Evaluate button. That will open a dialog asking you if you want to reset your password. If Evaluate is not seen, press enter key.

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Master_password
creator: davidsk

content:
My point is that the internet is the same to this office as it has been over the last 3 years (we measure) - YET within your last 2 updates, this behavior shows up... eg most recently this afternoon, I click on a new message, and TB goes inconsistently "not responding" for 5-10sec, or it displays the msg immediately.

Same behavior across the 2 email hosting folks we use - HostGator and 1and1...

Running WIN10 up to date...we use Ookla Speedtest to keep the ISP honest...

Thank you
creator: ALBERT72

content: Again, I am not seeing this issue reported by others, and I would hesitate to report a problem that, if true, would be impacting thousands of users' use of Thunderbird. However, if you believe there is a flaw, you're welcome to report it at bugzilla.mozilla.org. Thank you. An option would be to install a prior version to confirm your findings prior to submitting the bug report.
creator: davidsk

content: The contact files are abook.sqlite and history.sqlite and any variations, such as abook-1.sqlite, etc.
creator: davidsk

content: Do you have a VPN? This sounds like a timing issue, you have Thunderbird in the startup group and it loads before the VPN, so it works. After it does not because the VPN is not compatible with email and is not loaded.

content: Normally, I would suggest just install again over what you have. But there may have been some corruption during that Windows update, so my suggestion would be this: - copy the profile from c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird to anywhere else for safekeeping - download and install thunderbird over the top of current setup - start thunderbird
creator: davidsk

content: I would just reinstall over the current installation, assuming some glitch happened during prior install or update. That may fix it, as this approach often fixes unknown problems.
creator: davidsk
